channel.title: Comments on: You have entered Lower Guk

item.title: By: gesikah
item.dc:creator: gesikah
item.description: Right up until we quit (yes for realz this time!), my personal favorites were pwn-pronounced-poon and melee-pronounced-meelee. Oh and uh-rah-THEYE buh-SIN, poor guy never did live that one down.
item.content:encoded: Right up until we quit (yes for realz this time!), my personal favorites were pwn-pronounced-poon and melee-pronounced-meelee. Oh and uh-rah-THEYE buh-SIN, poor guy never did live that one down.

item.title: By: ghiest
item.dc:creator: ghiest
item.description:
I liked Guk, but it was possibly the most annoying going there all the damn time with my brother (who at the time was a mage early on), Buggy pathing routes were the cause of many a death in that place, along with trains and idiots.
But I still do remember it with fondness, camping the FBSS (I think it was that... I'm getting old memory ain't so good :P) for 32 hours straight for my monk. And then the epic part down there as well for almost as equal amount of time. As you can expect my familiarity with the zone and it's inhabitants was quite well versed.
I still prefered Chardok and more so Sebelis as a well designed dungeon.
item.content:encoded:
I liked Guk, but it was possibly the most annoying going there all the damn time with my brother (who at the time was a mage early on), Buggy pathing routes were the cause of many a death in that place, along with trains and idiots.

But I still do remember it with fondness, camping the FBSS (I think it was that… I’m getting old memory ain’t so good :P) for 32 hours straight for my monk. And then the epic part down there as well for almost as equal amount of time. As you can expect my familiarity with the zone and it’s inhabitants was quite well versed.

I still prefered Chardok and more so Sebelis as a well designed dungeon.

item.title: By: celerie
item.dc:creator: celerie
item.description:
ooh, i remember discovering that the daoc server "nimue" was actually pronounced "nim-uh-way" not "nim-yoo". oopsie.
hearing ppl actually pronounce the p in "pwn" was a source of endless entertainment for me as well. "yay, we pee-owned them," made me grin a lot.
item.content:encoded:
ooh, i remember discovering that the daoc server “nimue” was actually pronounced “nim-uh-way” not “nim-yoo”. oopsie.

hearing ppl actually pronounce the p in “pwn” was a source of endless entertainment for me as well. “yay, we pee-owned them,” made me grin a lot.
